Comments_List:
- A better appreciation of the wide application of biophysics
- Great practice in the applications of probability theory to real systems
The class introduced me to lots of biophysics concepts, and gave me the general overview of how physics can be applied to biology to understand biological processes.
Modeling biological phenomenon with physics ideas.

Strengths:
- Lectures/Content well-planed and documented
- Well-constructed problem sets covering many applications

Weaknesses:
- Could probably cover more mathematically-oriented content
For people with little background in physics, it is sometimes hard to catch up.

As a physics major in college, I feel the physics is too simply for me and the biological stuff are not related to my research. It is not necessary to take such class for student with very solid physics skills.
